summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in New York discussing a call from Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys, Chris and Mark. The prosecutor updates colleagues about the call, notes the investigation is ongoing, and asks whether to issue document subpoenas to Maxwell for items like photos, communications, journals, and financial records associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Chris
persons.context: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys who called the prosecutor to check in on the status of the investigation and see if anything was needed from them.

persons.name: Mark
persons.context: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys who called the prosecutor to check in on the status of the investigation and see if anything was needed from them.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM' in the email; the prosecutor considers issuing document subpoenas to her for items associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the associate whose related items (photos, communications, financial records) are considered for subpoena from Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: The prosecutor seeks documents from Maxwell that are associated with Epstein, indicating their close connection in the investigation.
Chris is identified as one of Maxwell's attorneys, representing her in the ongoing investigation.
Mark is identified as one of Maxwell's attorneys, representing her in the ongoing investigation.

events.title: Call from Maxwell's Attorneys
events.description: Attorneys Chris and Mark called the prosecutor to check in on the status of the investigation and see if anything was needed from them.

keyFacts: On January 21, 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys, Chris and Mark, contacted the prosecutor to check on the investigation's status.
The prosecutor confirms the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell is ongoing.
The prosecutor considers issuing document subpoenas to Ghislaine Maxwell for items associated with Jeffrey Epstein, including photos, communications, journals, memo pads, and financial records.
